duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide psychological evaluation, intervention, and support to patients enrolled in the medical weight loss program.
Address psychological issues, body image, self-esteem, social support, and quality of life.
Screen for and provide treatment and referrals for eating disorders.
Create a safe, therapeutic environment for patients with obesity.
Utilize motivational interviewing and evidence-based techniques to support lifestyle change.
Participate in the development of treatment plans in coordination with medical providers and registered dietitians.
Develop differential diagnoses for patients and ensure proper referrals to other team members as needed.
Coordinate with psychiatrists and primary care physicians when needed to manage patient’s overall care.
Participate and lead various group interventions, including support, emotional eating, and body image groups.
Provide documentation of clinical services as per departmental guidelines.
Make referrals for case management services for a complex population that faces many barriers in the community.
Participate in continuing education and other appropriate activities to maintain current licensure.
Keep up to date on emerging advances in weight management treatment approaches.
Conduct evidence-based psychological testing as necessary.
Supervise and train psychology interns and externs.

education_certification.credential: Doctoral Degree in clinical Psychology, Counseling Psychology, School Psychology, Forensic Psychology, Clinical Health Psychology, or Neuro-Psychology. Valid license as a Psychologist issued by the New York State Department of Education.
